thread.title: Egg the pug dead, police confirm
thread.title_full: Egg the pug dead, police confirm

title: Egg the pug dead, police confirm
text:
Share on Twitter 
IN A sad twist to an already mysterious case, Egg, the 14-week-old pug who sparked a frantic Sydney-wide search, has died. 
Just one day after his owner was charged with making a false report for claiming the pup was stolen at knifepoint by a trio of brazen thieves, police said his owner had admitted that Egg had actually died rather than being stolen. 
Egg was not stolen. He died at his owner’s home and his “body was disposed of”, a NSW Police spokeswoman said. 
Police said the cause of death was unknown but 7 News reports the puppy choked on a dog treat . 
The sad confirmation follows fresh pleas from police yesterday for information about the whereabouts of Egg. 
Egg had been ‘missing’ since February 9, when his owner came forward with his story the pooch had been snatched. 
It sparked a public appeal to help find the pooch. Egg’s 29-year-old owner told police the three men armed with knives had approached him as he walked the dog near Sydney Olympic Park. 
They demanded his wallet and backpack, and also took baby Egg, he claimed, and he even provided detailed description of the ‘dognappers’. 
The 29-year-old man has been charged with making a false report of armed robbery and is due to appear at Burwood Local Court in April. 
RIP, Egg.
